messageHandlers.script:
import traceback
		try:
			#Send the dataset to Excel
			filename = 'setting_staff_' + str(system.date.format(system.date.now(),"yyyyMMddHHmmss")) + '.xls'
			data = self.props.data
			data = list(data[i].values() for i in range(0,len(data)))
			headers = ['lastName','jobTitle','genderId','active','suffix','breezeId','genderName','firstName','userRights','humanId','phone','dob','options','altPhone','middleName','isFacilitator','staffId','email']
			dataset = system.dataset.toDataSet(headers,data)
			columnsToKeep = ['active', 'isFacilitator', 'firstName','middleName','lastName','breezeId','jobTitle', 'phone','altPhone','dob','genderName','email','userRights']
			dataset = system.dataset.filterColumns(dataset, columnsToKeep)
			dataset = system.dataset.formatDates(dataset, "MM/dd/yyyy")
			headers = system.dataset.getColumnHeaders(dataset)
			headers[0] = "Active"
			headers[1] = "Facilitator"
			headers[2] = "First"
			headers[3] = "Middle"
			headers[4] = "Last"
			headers[5] = "Breeze ID"
			headers[6] = "Job Title"
			headers[7] = "Phone"
			headers[8] = "Alt Phone"
			headers[9] = "DOB"
			headers[10] = "Gender"
			headers[11] = "Email"
			headers[12] = "User Rights"
			
			dataset.setColumnNames(headers)
			xlFile = system.dataset.toExcel(True,dataset)
			system.perspective.download(filename, xlFile)
		except:   
			logger = system.util.getLogger("Staff Dashboard tableToExcel")
			msg = traceback.format_exc()
			logger.error(msg)

system.perspective.print('Refresh Query')
	view = self.view
	view.refreshBinding("custom.userRights")
	view.refreshBinding("custom.sql_data")
